channel.title: Tutorials on AutoML 2023
channel.description: Recent content in Tutorials on AutoML 2023

item.title: Tutorial
item.description: Apples and Apples: Experimentation with and Benchmarking of Hyperparameter Tuning Date: Wednesday, Sep 13, 2023, 14:30 - 16:00 Speakers: Matthias Seeger, Amazon Jacek Golebiowski, Amazon Matthias Poloczek, Amazon David Salinas, Amazon Abstract: Empirical studies in current HPO publications are often apples-and-oranges comparisons, plagued by many confounding factors, which can lower trust in the field and hinders adoption among practitioners, especially in industry.

item.title: Tutorial
item.description: AutoGluon v1.0: Shattering the AutoML Ceiling with Zero Lines of Code Date: Tuesday, Sep 12, 2023, 11:00 - 13:00 Speakers: Nick Erickson, Amazon Oleksandr Shchur, Amazon David Salinas, Amazon Abstract: AutoGluon is an open source AutoML framework that shattered the SOTA in AutoML on its initial release in 2019 and continues to push the boundaries of what AutoML can achieve.

item.title: Tutorial
item.description: Language Modelling for Optimization Date: Wednesday, Sep 13, 2023, 11:00 - 12:30 Speakers: Xingyou Song, Google Deepmind Yutian Chen, Google Deepmind Abstract: Undeniably, Large Language Models (LLMs) have stirred an extraordinary wave of innovation in the machine learning research domain, leaving substantial impact across diverse sectors such as reinforcement learning, robotics, and computer vision.

item.title: Tutorial
item.description: Meta-Learning for Hyperparameter Optimization Date: Wednesday, Sep 13, 2023, 14:30 - 16:00 Speakers: Martin Wistuba, Amazon Research Abstract: Hyperparameter Optimization (HPO) has been recognized as a crucial element in achieving state-of-the-art performance across a wide range of machine learning tasks.

item.title: Tutorial
item.description: A Tutorial on Meta-Reinforcement Learning Date: Wednesday, Sep 13, 2023, 11:00 - 12:30 Speakers: Jacob Beck, University of Oxford Risto Vuorio, University of Oxford Abstract: A major drawback of deep reinforcement learning (RL) is its poor data efficiency.

item.title: Tutorial
item.description: Open Source Vizier: Googleâ€™s Blackbox and Hyperparameter Optimization at Scale Date: Tuesday, Sep 12, 2023, 16:00 - 18:00 Speakers: Xingyou Song, Google Deepmind Zhang, Google Deepmind Sagi Perel, Google Deepmind Abstract: Vizier is the de-facto system for blackbox optimization and hyperparameter tuning at Google, having serviced some of Google’s largest products and research efforts.

item.title: Tutorial
item.description: A Survey of Methods for Automated Algorithm Configuration Date: Wednesday, Sep 13, 2023, 14:30 - 16:00 Speakers: Marcel Wever, MCML, LMU Munich Jasmin Brandt, Paderborn University Viktor Bengs, LMU Munich Abstract: Given a parametrized algorithm, a set of training problem instances, and one or multiple objective functions, algorithm configuration (AC) is concerned with the automated search for a suitable parameterization of the given algorithm.
